speaker: Keeper & NPCs
lines: Griffin McElroy

speaker: Aubrey Little/Lady Flame
lines: Travis McElroy

speaker: Edmund “Ned” Chicane
lines: Clint McElroy

speaker: Duck Newton
lines: Justin McElroy

speaker: Griffin
lines: Previously, on The Adventure Zone…

speaker: Presence
lines: There is no more time to delay, Duck Newton! Events have been put into motion that require your immediate action.

speaker: Justin
lines: I mean, I guess I run through the gate.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You hear the sound of the monster getting louder and louder and… you run toward this empty gate, and then we see that clearing again, and the archway, within which Duck Newton was just standing, is empty.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You catch Dani out of the corner of your eye, and you get a little nervous for a second, and then a big blast of fire appears in your hands.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes.

speaker: Mama
lines: There’s another world connected to our own.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And one by one, they transform.

speaker: Mama
lines: So, that’s the truth of the matter. Monsters are… real!

speaker: Griffin
lines: The bobcat starts charging toward you, and Barclay looks at you, and he says

speaker: Barclay
lines: God, I hope you can keep a secret!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And in the blink of an eye, this gentle, bearded man you were just talking to disappears, and in his place… is Bigfoot!

speaker: [Theme music (The Adventure Zone
lines: Amnesty Theme by Griffin McElroy) plays]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ned… there’s Bigfoot, Ned! He is standing about seven… seven and a half feet tall?

speaker: Travis
lines: How many hands, Griffin? How many hands tall?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, like, twelve Bigfoot hands.

speaker: Travis
lines: Whoa!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, and those are big hands.

speaker: Clint
lines: That’s a big Bigfoot.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He is covered in fur that makes your current sort of Wookiee outfit, which you’re definitely still wearing, which is such a charming little scene? It makes your Wookiee outfit look positively inauthentic. And he’s racing toward this lifeless but animated bobcat, and the two of them crash together a couple dozen yards in front of you. Your car is a couple dozen yards behind you. What do you do?

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, I run for the car! Ned runs for the car.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. And—

speaker: Travis
lines: And you’re still wearing the Bigfoot snowshoes?

speaker: Clint
lines: No, I kicked off the snowshoes, I’m sorry.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: I kicked off the snowshoes and the gloves.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You just left those behind?

speaker: Clint
lines: Hell yeah! I gotta get in the car!

speaker: Justin
lines: All right.

speaker: Clint
lines: Ned’s gotta get in the car, man.

speaker: Travis
lines: Now, I do wanna remind- a bobcat is not, like, a mountain lion, right? A bobcat is, like—

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m envisioning, like, about that size. Big ol’ cat. So you’re—

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s a biiiiig bobcat.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re just gonna take off?

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, I’m gonna jump behind the wheel of the car— let me explain somethin’ a li’l about Ned’s mindset.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: Ned is not ordinarily somebody that jumps into the fire. Ned is not somebody who likes to fight. If Ned can avoid a conflict, he will. But in this case, Ned, having just seen a man transform into a Bigfoot and see a ghoulish bobcat, is absolutely, one hundred percent convinced this is a dream.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay—

speaker: Clint
lines: So Ned is going to live it as if it’s a dream.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, it’s about dusk, so you hop behind the wheel of the car and sort of, fumbling, maybe a little nervous, start the ignition, and as you do, the headlights kick on, and now you can see this fight scene happening in front of you much clearer, [Clint Oh, yeah.] and you see that this bobcat has Barclay pinned down. [Clint Yep!] And Barclay’s kind of in trouble, it’s sorta slashin’ at him and tearing at him, and it looks like this thing’s got the upper hand on Barclay.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, yeah, well I throw the Lincoln into drive and gun it, because it’s a dream, man! Let’s enjoy it, let’s have some adventure, he’s been stuck in this crummy museum, so he’s gonna floor it and drive it right at them.

speaker: Griffin
lines: O...kay. Um… are you trying to hit both of them?

speaker: Clint
lines: I am going to drive straight for them and hope that the Bigfoot, that Barclay is able to either roll away, or—

speaker: Justin
lines: Lot easier to hit the Bigfoot than the bobcat, batch.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [laughing] No, no, no, it’s… yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: It’s a dream! If I get ‘em both, it’s two monsters, what’s the big deal?

speaker: Travis
lines: “So, did you listen to that new Adventure Zone?” “Yeah, I really liked it, then Dad killed Bigfoot?”

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah…

speaker: Griffin
lines: “Who was, like, a dude? And then...”

speaker: Clint
lines: I am—

speaker: Travis
lines: “Who he spoke to, and was already a fan-favorite, but now he’s dead, I guess!”

speaker: Clint
lines: Ned is a terrific driver, remember, that’s one of his things.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [sarcastically] I didn’t know he could lift a car up in the air while he was driving it to specific—!

speaker: Clint
lines: He is going to do some amazing Joie Chitwood stunt driving shit—

speaker: Justin
lines: No-scope car skills.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re gonna have to roll to Act Under Pressure [Travis Real good.], and I will remind you the way that rolls in this game work if you don’t do amazing, things can happen.

speaker: Travis
lines: And I wanna remind everybody, ‘cause we didn’t do this at all in the last two episodes, you have the Luck option… that you can exercise at any time—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, so we have not talked about Luck. Luck is a fascinating thing in this game, and it kinda makes up for the fact that there’s not, like, a ton of healing, or whatever? You have a meter, and I think it has, like, seven marks in it. And this is for your character’s whole career, you never refill this, you never really get this back, where, if you want to, at any time, you can change a roll to a 12 or avoid all harm from an injury, and you mark one luck. Now, once you’ve gotten rid of all your luck, really bad things can start happening to you. I basically get to go as hard on you as I possibly wanna go, because you are what the game calls Doomed, at that point, so… but, yeah, let’s do this thing!

speaker: Clint
lines: All right, so, I can invoke- do I do it before I roll?

speaker: Travis
lines: No, I think you do it post.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yes, it is reactionary.

speaker: Clint
lines: Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: And it should be a pretty desperate thing, right, ‘cause you’ve only got seven—

speaker: Griffin
lines: It is worst-case scenario things. Like, for instance, if you’re gonna kill Bigfoot with your car, you may wanna use a li’l bit of luck on it.

speaker: Justin
lines: All right, Clint, just- well, ‘kay, that’s legit.

speaker: Clint
lines: Eleven.

speaker: Griffin
lines: All right!

speaker: Justin
lines: Dad has his—

speaker: Clint
lines: And I add a plus one for driving. I get plus one to any rating…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Wait, what is it?

speaker: Clint
lines: Plus one ongoing while driving.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, this would definitely count for that, so that’s a 12.

speaker: Travis
lines: Sick, bro.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, with that, Barclay is fighting this bobcat and is kind of underneath it, and then sees the headlights, like, soaring towards him, and he puts a foot on the bobcat’s chest as it’s sort of on top of him, and flings it backwards, and then quickly rolls out of the way, and the Bigfoot— the bobcat sort of slams right into the hood of the Continental as you are going. And it’s a big, sturdy boat, so a mountain cat slamming into [Clint Detroit, man!] it doesn’t do a whole lotta damage to the car. It does plenty of damage to the bobcat, who just rolls over the car, and then I imagine you bring it to a halt, after that, as you see in your rearview mirror…

speaker: Clint
lines: I do one of those sweet moves where I change the gear shift, slam on the brakes, it does a little curve and [Travis Oh E-brake.] pulls up right next to Barclay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ah, alright yeah you look in your rearview mirror the bobcat is not moving. And then from your rearview mirror you see the bobcat defeated on the ground, although it looks just as lifeless now as it did during its attack, and sort of right as it lands that black fluid that was dripping out of its mouth, it like spastically shoots out of its body in these thick rivulets which kind of tangle together on the ground before slithering, like with a will of its own, quickly back into the forest. Like within a few seconds that black fluid is out of sight.

speaker: Ned
lines: Hahaha! How hideously obnoxious! [chuckles] I love this dream!

speaker: Travis
lines: You’re going a little bit Odin there. Was that what you were going for?

speaker: Justin
lines: “Tiny man”!

speaker: Clint
lines: Ned’s having fun, man. He doesn’t think any of this is real.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Let’s jump over to Duck. Duck, you stepped through the gate, and for a moment…

speaker: Travis
lines: Can I just say I’ve been kicking myself since we recorded because none of us made an “Exit, Pursued by Bear” comment.

speaker: Travis
lines: And it was right like there, you guys.

speaker: Clint
lines: Sorry.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, we could have done that, and then we could have done some quick improv games, like maybe some Freeze, and then we’d talk about like, what song from Jesus Christ Superstar’s our favorite.

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Duck, you step through the gate, and you’re in this bright place for just a moment, Duck, and the wind that you felt whipping at you from the stone archway is still blowing through you while you’re in this space. But you’re quickly out of it and the light fades, and you know you’re somewhere else. But your vision is somehow… off. Almost like you’re seeing this place with, like, a watercolor filter. Everything is kind of shifting wildly. Almost like the A-ha video.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. And you also feel somewhat sick, and kind of like, angry? It is disorienting, to say the least. And behind you, pretty close to you, you can see it despite your sort of disorientation, there’s another stone gate in this place identical to the one you entered. And from the hard stone floor that you’re laying on you can tell that whatever, wherever this gate is, it is enclosed inside of another, sort of large stone structure. There are these  massive pillars propping up the ceiling overhead. And through the pillars you can see the world outside. Only your vision is so, sort of, impaired that you can only faintly make out, like, there are some bright colorful shapes in the distance, some round buildings. There’s a massive castle beyond them, with a large orange shape jutting out of the ground just in front of that castle. And you feel that anger inside of you just kind of building, almost unnaturally, and it’s alarming, but not quite as alarming as these two figures who are standing in front of a pillar, a pair of columns in front of you, who respond to your presence with surprise, and in an instant they are on you, jabbing you with these rods, and you feel this shock, and you’re unconscious.

speaker: And when you awaken, you are in a dark, small room, and your arms are bound to a wooden chair positioned in front of a big, sturdy wooden table. And you feel something soft and light draped around your neck, and as you kind of look down you realized you’re wearing some sort of scarf that your captors placed on you. It’s made of some sort of incredibly soft fabric that you can’t quite deduce. And for whatever reason that anger and disorientation you felt when you entered this place is just gone. You’re Duck again. And seated across from you is a person, you can’t really tell too much about them other than that, thanks to the large set of chainmail armor they’re wearing, covered by a tabard featuring an orange crystal radiating light in every direction. You can faintly see these two black, beady eyes through a slit in the helmet this person’s wearing, which is adorned with two goat’s horns on top. And as you regain consciousness, strapped to this chair and front of this table in this dark room, this person immediately addresses you, and they say
Person
lines: You’re in a lot of trouble right now, but I want you to know that I am willing to give you the benefit of the doubt. Because based on your outfit, I’m guessing you’re part of some sort of local woodland army, or forest militia, or something like that.

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah, that’ll do.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Person
lines: We’re both men of the law, and so I’m hoping we can come to an understanding here. I’m thinking maybe you just stumbled into the gate accidentally. Maybe you didn’t come here with any ill intent. Am I on the right track?

speaker: Travis
lines: [same accent] “Now I’m just a small kingdom lawyer”

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah, I mean, that pretty much sums it up.

speaker: Person
lines: What’s your name, pal?

speaker: Duck
lines: It’s Duck. Duck Newton.

speaker: Vincent
lines: Excellent name, powerful name. I’m Vincent.

speaker: Duck
lines: It’s a nickname.

speaker: Vincent
lines: I’m Vincent, and uh, well, before we go any further I gotta know, and this is real important that you tell the truth now, all right? I need to know how you knew that the gate was there in the first place. Did the human called “Mama” tell you?

speaker: Duck
lines: Mama... No, I don’t know… I mean, I know my mama, but I don’t know a Mama. To be honest, uh, it was just sort of there, man. I don’t know. It just sort of appeared. I was being pursued by a large, I would say non-Earth bear, maybe. [Griffin laughs] I dunno, I ain’t  never seen its like. And I just kinda ran for the gate, man, I’ll be honest I don’t really have a great explanation for you. I’ll say this, you know, I’m not freaking out right now, I’ve seen some weird shit in the past and narrowly avoided being sorta looped up in it, seems that ship has sailed [laughs], but I’m, you know, all non-malicious on my part. Just trying to “Exit, pursued by bear.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: He takes out a little notebook from a fold in his tabard, and he’s writing down some of the stuff that you say almost like he’s taking a statement. And he takes his pencil and he taps at a point of his notes and he says

speaker: Vincent
lines: A big, non-Earth bear, huh?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Vincent
lines: Well it sounds like Mama’s maybe not keepin’ up her end of the bargain, but I guess we’ll circle back on that later.

speaker: Duck
lines: I mean I’m not saying, I don’t know if you wanna write this down, I’m not saying that it was a space bear. I just, you know, not sorta a regular bear, you know?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Vincent
lines: Believe me, I know better than you might think. But I still don’t understand how you found the gate. It is unfortunate that you don’t know how ‘cause, buddy, I can’t let you leave here until I figure out where the hole in our security protocols lies.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And with that, this figure takes off their helmet, and as they do so you notice those two goat horns on top of the helmet actually slide through holes on the top of the helmet as it’s removed. And they place their helmet gently on the table, and as they do, you see the face of the person sitting across from you. It’s the face of a goat.

speaker: Aubrey, you are walking in the woods behind Amnesty Lodge with Mama, who is carrying an oil lantern in one hand as she leads you swiftly through the pines. And you’ve just left the Amnesty Lodge after, sort of, the big reveal from the last episode, and she says
Mama
lines: Now there’s somethin’ I need to show you, but before we do anything else Aubrey I need you to swear on your life that you’re not gonna tell another soul about what you learned tonight. Can you do that? I’m not, I don’t want you to take this lightly, this is like end of the world-level secret. I need your absolute discretion on this.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Mama, not only do I swear on my life, I swear on the life of Dr. Harris Bonkers, PhD.

speaker: Clint
lines: Woah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Is Dr. Harris Bonkers with you? Is Dr. Harris Bonkers always with you?

speaker: Travis
lines: Do you mean like, spiritually?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And physically.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, um, yeah. You know the term I’ve been thinking about a lot, and I think Aubrey has, now that she has done real magic, is “Familiar.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yes yes yes yes yes yes.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay. But I think maybe for this, I think just because it’s dangerous maybe she left Dr. Harris Bonkers with Dani.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Yeah, I think Dani was happy to play with Dr. Harris Bonkers.

speaker: Travis
lines: Does Dani have kind of a Laura Dern vibe?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I don’t, we’ll figure out Dani’s relation to Laura Dern, I think, as we play. It’s one of those things you’re supposed to leave empty spaces in the world and fill it out as you go.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah, I understand.

speaker: Clint
lines: Last Jedi Laura Dern? Jurassic Park Laura Dern?

speaker: Travis
lines: Jurassic Park Laura Dern was where I was—

speaker: Clint
lines: Jurassic Park Laura Dern, okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Peak Dern.

speaker: Travis
lines: Peak Dern. We’re talkin’ about top Dern here.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mama says

speaker: Mama
lines: I don’t mean to scare you, Aubrey. It’s just, can you imagine what would happen if the wrong people learned about a place full of magic and monsters? And everything? What they might do to take advantage of that kinda power, to own it? I have to—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Mama, let me reassure you right now. I can make fire with my mind? I’m not really scared of anything. So…

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says

speaker: Mama
lines: I know that, but it’s important you understand the gravity of the situation. ‘Cause I’ve dedicated my entire adult life to keepin’ that stuff out of the public eye. It is the most important thing we do around these parts.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Uh-huh.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you’re walking a bit further into the woods and she starts to explain, she says

speaker: Mama
lines: Okay, so, this other world, it’s called Sylvane.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Which by the way I picked that name out like a year ago, then when dad had a character called Sylvane in TAZ Commitment I was like “Oh, interesting.” It’s a good—

speaker: Travis
lines: Wheels within wheels, my friends.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: Well, you actually returned the favor because I got Silvane from an actor that I worked with, Remy Silvane.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Woah.

speaker: Clint
lines: And then you turned around in the same episode and named your character Remy.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, it was a—

speaker: Travis
lines: Sympatico. I also want everyone to picture that during this whole walk, and like, as Mama’s talking she is just, Aubrey is like snapping her fingers and making, like lighting a lighter, like lighting a Zippo.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Absolutely. I love it.

speaker: Clint
lines: Always good to do in a forest, yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well she’s snapping her fingers, and like her thumb catches on fire, then she’s snapping it out, and just kinda doing that [makes snapping sound] on and off.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I love this, we got some of that in Commitment, the few minutes after you discover you have superpowers. Okay, anyway, Mama says

speaker: Mama
lines: Sylvane, Aubrey, it’s an incredible place, it is a living world. And I mean that literally. Whole place is alive, sustaining its inhabitants with this magic power and that’s a thing that those inhabitants are understandably pretty protective of.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Uh-huh.

speaker: Mama
lines: But problem is, throughout history, those gates on our side have been poppin’ up all over the place, and humans have been crossing over into Sylvane and making a mess of things. Made some bad blood between us and the Sylvs. It’s hard to blame either side, really, ‘cuz where these gates appear on earth so do the, well, we call ‘em Abominations. But don’t you worry none ‘bout that though, that’s mine and Barclay’s cross to bear, not yours. But the worse that things got in Sylvane, because of the humans, the stricter their laws got. And today they got some pretty Draconian laws in effect governing who can and can’t live there. And the outcasts, well they don’t really got anywhere to go. Hence, the Amnesty Lodge. I give those Sylvs a safe place to sleep at night, and that seems about the least that I can do for ‘em. And Aubrey, I don’t know nothin’ about your life and what you want from it, but you could be safe there too, I think. Somehow, you fit into this picture, I know it.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Okay!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Let’s jump back to Ned. You see Barclay kinda wounded. He’s got some big scratches down his neck, and his torso, and he’s kinda shambling away from the car towards the bobcat, and he hunches down and looks at the bobcat kind of rolls it over, eyeballs it, sees it’s thoroughly dead, and he walks a little bit closer to—

speaker: Travis
lines: [in singsong voice] Not merely dead, but really most sincerely dead.

speaker: Justin
lines: [crosstalk] So let’s get back to the showtunes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] How many more musical theatre references can we make in this show? [laughter] And then he walks a little bit closer to the car and he hunches down and he picks up that hempen bracelet up off the ground. And he wraps it back around his wrist and instantly, he’s Barclay again.

speaker: Travis
lines: Is he still injured in this form, Ditto?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, in this human form, Ned, you can actually see those scratches are still there. He’s breathing sort of heavily. He’s not like, horribly injured, but he’s definitely sort of battle damaged nonetheless. And he walks over to you, Ned, and opens up the passenger-side door and gets inside. And he puts on his seatbelt, I think, ‘cause he’s a very safe boy. And he says

speaker: Barclay
lines: You said you’ve been to Amnesty Lodge before, right, Ned?

speaker: Ned
lines: Yeah, I uh, obtained one of your delicious Monte Cristos.

speaker: Barclay
lines: Yeah, the sandwich was great.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Barclay
lines: I need you to get me there—

speaker: Ned
lines: And I think there was a junior Chamber of Commerce meeting there, I believe.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Barclay
lines: I need you to get me there right away, Ned. I can explain everything when we get there.

speaker: Ned
lines: Are you sure you wouldn’t rather go to a vet?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He kinda chuckles, and then as he laughs he’s kinda like, hurting a little bit, and so he kinda catches himself, and he says

speaker: Barclay
lines: No, we gotta get to the lodge. I can’t, for obvious reasons, I kinda can’t go to any sort of medical practitioner back in Kepler.

speaker: Ned
lines: Of course, of course.

speaker: Griffin
lines: As he’s saying that, you see a couple more shapes stalk out of the woods, I think it’s just two more bobcats, and they’re sort of prowling like jungle cat style out of the woods towards your car, and he says

speaker: Barclay
lines: I know this is a lot to take in right now, I know you probably think you’re in some sort of weird dream, I assure you—

speaker: Ned
lines: Oh yes, I certainly do.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Barclay
lines: I assure you, it is not, things are pretty bad right now and if you wanna keep Kepler safe I need you to get me to the lodge, all right?

speaker: Ned
lines: Oh good, that’s good, I like that. You’ve kind of heightened the danger. Of course, my friend! Let’s go to the lodge, you must do me one favor. Try not to bleed on the fine corinthian leather, all right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Barclay
lines: I’ll do my best?

speaker: Ned
lines: Onward!

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Barclay
lines: Take the woods, Ned, time’s of the essence, I can get us through it, but I need you to cut as straight a path as you can, all right?

speaker: Ned
lines: [laughs] You got it.

speaker: Clint
lines: I throw it into drive, I press the pedal and yell

speaker: Ned
lines: Yoinks! And away!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Do you aim for either of the bobcats as you’re driving forward?

speaker: Clint
lines: Ah hell no, I’ll throw it in reverse.

speaker: Griffin
lines: All right.

speaker: Clint
lines: And yell “Yoinks and away!”

speaker: Griffin
lines: All right, you take off into the woods towards the Amnesty Lodge. And we’re moving at a nice clip right now, boys. I’m gonna jump back to Duck.

speaker: Duck
lines: All right, listen, I got some questions for you. What’s the name

speaker: of this place? What are the laws that dictate who can and can’t cross over? [Griffin laughs] On the other side, what are those, where do the people who get caught from the other side stay? I need these questions answered in excruciating, lengthy detail. I am not aware—
Clint
lines: Between you and Vincent, you’re playing bad ranger, good ranger.

speaker: Duck
lines: I am not aware of any of the answers to these questions. Please begin and include them—

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think— You guys are all about to meet up, so I think there will be some sharing of notes once that happens so that we don’t create a, uh, a hole in the fuckin’ narrative universe I’m trying to piece together.

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] No, this is where the propeller spins, the goat man answers all of the questions, and then Duck’s like, “Oh, okay! That all totally makes sense.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Vincent, the Goatman, which is not pejorative, there’s a real cryptid named that, says—

speaker: Justin
lines: [laughing] Vincent the Goat Man? That’s very familiar.

speaker: Clint
lines: [singing] Vincent the Goat Man!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, just the Goatman. He looks at you, and maybe you are a little bit uneasy, ‘cause it’s now this sort of humanoid goat talking to you. He says

speaker: Vincent
lines: So— our two worlds, Duck, they have something of an uneasy truce, and it’s based around your side keeping the existence of our side under wraps. So when strangers just stumble into our world, you can understand how that’s a problem for me. I’m kind of in charge of homeland security around here. So I need you to tell me— and really think about it— how did you first find out about the gate?

speaker: Duck
lines: Well, first off, I wouldn’t say I stumbled. I did move with sort of a dignified gait into the gate; it was very purposeful, let me start there. Secondly, um… so I’ve got this… aeeehhhh... I guess you’d call it, like, a weird… spirit, kind of thing, that’s been tryin’ to get me— used to try really hard, um, and then kind of let up, uh, to sort of… I guess, fight evil? I know that sounds ridiculous, but, uh, sort of fight evil. And they popped back up— I kind of thought it was a dream for a long time, but seein’ it just recently sorta dispelled that notion. So I think maybe, maybe they showed it to me? I’m honestly grasping at straws here, man, I’m a little bit out of my depth.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He is writing all this down in his notebook, and he kinda chews on the end of his pencil. And he catches himself chewing on it a little bit too much, and then he like pulls it out of his mouth, and he looks a little bit sheepish. Or goatish.

speaker: Justin
lines: Goatish, thank you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Then he says, um

speaker: Vincent
lines: Well, Duck, I wish I could say something to help, but that doesn’t really ring a bell for me. What you gotta understand about Sylvane— that’s what this place is called, by the way—

speaker: Justin
lines: Thank you.

speaker: Vincent
lines: This really ain’t a place that builds up, you know, prophecies, and heroes of legend to fight evil, and stuff like that. We’re a bit more humble than that. It kinda goes against our whole ethos, you see.

speaker: Duck
lines: See, that’s what I’m talking about! I think I could hang here, honestly. Like, that sounds pretty good to me.

speaker: Vincent
lines: Um, I wish I could help you out, but that’s not really possible. Resources are— well, they’re pretty scarce around here, it’s a really—

speaker: Duck
lines: No, you’re— you’re— listen, I’m havin’ a bit of fun, man. I got a job I gotta get back to and stuff, and there’s apparently some sort of space bear in my forest, so I do need to rectify that pretty quickly, but, uh—

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Vincent
lines: Yeah, I’ll have to talk about that with Mama next time I see her, but— um, listen, uh… I’m just as eager to avoid a war between our worlds as the next Syl[a][b][c]v, {{2853}} so how about this? Why don’t we let—

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m trying to avoid giving him an Appalachian accent. It’s hard to switch that switch back off. He says

speaker: Vincent
lines: So, how about this? Why don’t we let bygones be bygones, and I will let you go back through the gate unhindered, but you gotta promise me, Duck, you gotta forget this night ever happened. You walk through that gate and never come back. And you don’t tell anybody about the gate, or Sylvane... or the cool Goatman you talked to, and we won’t have a problem.

speaker: Duck
lines: Okay, listen, partner. Right underneath preservation of forest and the wildlife within, my number two skill is forgettin’ ‘bout weird shit, [Clint laughs] so you have come to the right department, here. That is no issue. Can I ask, as long as you know that your buddy Duck can keep a secret, what’s with the fancy, uh, the neckwear here?

speaker: Vincent
lines: Oh, that. The scarf is, um, well, it’s mine, actually. It’s Sylvan wool. It’s one of the curious parts about our arrangement of our two worlds and their connection. If a human steps foot into Silvane without wearin’ a garment from this world, they… they just absolutely lose it. Most of the assaults on this world—they happened long before my time, but from what I heard, those unadorned humans who crossed over went into somethin’ of a rage and tore the place apart without a second thought. Broke Sylvane’s heart right in two. You take that scarf off, and I imagine you’d get pretty hostile too.

speaker: Travis
lines: Humans are the worst.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Vincent
lines: I will take that back, but only once we get you to the gate ready to cross back over. Listen—

speaker: Duck
lines: So technically I guess it’d be mohair, right? I mean, if you made it yourself. Is this your own—?

speaker: Vincent
lines: No, God, it’s not from my— Jesus. It’s not from my—

speaker: Clint
lines: [laughing] That’s what I thought too!

speaker: Vincent
lines: That would be pretty gross. No, it’s mine. I wear it to keep warm. It’s not from my fur, Duck.

speaker: Travis
lines: “It’s Burberry!”

speaker: Griffin
lines: He says

speaker: Vincent
lines: Listen, Duck, I’m— I’m trying to be a good guy right now, Duck, which is tough for somebody in my position, so I gotta warn you I’m not the type to really forgive someone who backs out on a deal. So keep up your end of the bargain, and please do not make me regret this night, all right?

speaker: Duck
lines: Listen, I’d ask you to shake on it, but I have a feeling that could break weird pretty quick.

speaker: Griffin
lines: He puts up a hand. You notice, actually, that his bottom half, his, like, hindquarters, is straight up goat legs, but then he has these long, furry fingers on his hands that he holds up. He actually takes off, like, a gauntlet that he’s wearing and holds it over the table.

speaker: Clint
lines: [breathlessly] Oh my god, it’s Pan. It’s Pan!

speaker: Duck
lines: I’ll be dipped in shit and rolled in breadcrumbs, [Clint Call me Dan!] look at you, you got— you got hands and everything. All right! Uh, well, let’s shake on it, then.

speaker: Griffin

speaker: Let’s jump back to Aubrey. Aubrey, you’ve been hiking through the woods with Mama for about 20 minutes now, and—
Aubrey
lines: Are we there yet? I mean, I don’t want to be that person, but, like… I’m wearing combat boots?

lines: She says

speaker: Aubrey

speaker: Mama

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re walking through the woods with Mama, sort of having this conversation, and her oil lantern and the moon overhead are the only light on your journey. And now you see—

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, is it? [makes fire noises]

speaker: Griffin
lines: And the flames you’re producing with your hand.

speaker: Travis
lines: Thank you.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And now you see the moonlight shining down on a clearing just in front of you, and there’s a carpet of pine needles on the forest floor, but they are distributed in a kind of peculiar pattern. They’re giving a wide berth to the clearing’s most eye-catching feature. There is a stone archway standing before you in the center of the clearing. It’s a humble structure, just two large slabs of stone with a third perched on top of it. And Mama clears her throat and she says

speaker: Mama
lines: Okay, this is gonna sound pretty strange, I reckon, but there’s somethin’ here that you cannot see right now. So don’t go runnin’ forward, cause I don’t want you to bash your face right into it, all right? And it’s gonna look like I’m just sort of speakin’ it into existence, but that’s not really—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: The Stonehenge thing?

speaker: Mama
lines: [long pause] You… you can already see it?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: “In ancient times, hundreds of years before the dawn of history”… have you not seen Spinal Tap?

speaker: Griffin
lines: She puts a hand on your shoulder, and she says

speaker: Mama
lines: Aubrey, I—that doesn’t make any sense. There’s—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: It’s three rocks. Can you see it?

speaker: Griffin
lines: She puts her hands in her temples, which is sort of the go-to move for any Adventure Zone NPC, and she says

speaker: Mama
lines: It is not supposed to work like this, Aubrey! There is— there’s supposed to be an enchantment on it that makes it so you can’t see it unless you know it’s there.

speaker: Aubrey

speaker: Griffin
lines: You see her not responding to your—

speaker: Aubrey
lines: ‘‘’Tis a magic place!”

speaker: Griffin
lines: —to your japes. She’s pondering. Her face is, like, toward the ground. And then there’s a third light source shining into this scene from close by in the woods, and you hear a loud sound getting louder, moving quickly in your direction.

speaker: And Ned, Barclay’s in the front seat, and he’s surveying his wounds in the mirror, in the sun visor. And he does that for a few minutes, and then, as like, the Continental is rumbling over the occasional sort of root as it maneuvers through the woods, and then he flips the visor back up, and he slams a fist down on the dashboard, and he points forward with his other hand, and he yells
Barclay
lines: Look out!

lines: What do you do?

lines: Well, obviously, I- I- do I need to do, like, an investigation, or an observation, thing?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, not really. I mean, I can tell you, you don’t— you’re going through the pines, and so your vision is kind of occluded a bit, but you do not see anything in front of you.

lines: Well, then, I slam on the brakes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think this would— this would probably be a good Act Under Pressure roll.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [crosstalk] Well, to slam on it with the proper, sort of, reaction time.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Eight. Uh, mixed success.

speaker: Justin

speaker: Griffin

lines: And a Taco Bell cup gets stuck underneath and he careens into a tree. [Griffin laughing]

lines: Uh, I don’t know if there’s a Taco Bell in— in— yeah, there’s probably a Taco Bell.

lines: Gas station.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You slam on your brakes with pretty good reaction time, and as you do so, you enter this clearing, and you see a young woman with a sort of hip haircut, and a sort of larger, older woman wearing a big long duster, holding an oil lantern. And that’s all ya see! And you slam on the brakes, and the car starts to careen to a halt as you drive into this clearing, and you are moving pretty slowly when the car runs into something. And it’s weird, ‘cause there’s nothing there. It’s not a tremendous amount of damage to the car, the fender’s probably pretty busted up, but the car sputters to a halt as it collides with some sort of invisible shape. And Barclay looks at the two other people in this clearing, and he hops out of the car and his eyes lock with Mama. And Mama says

speaker: Mama
lines: Well… evenin’, Barclay.

speaker: Travis
lines: And I want you to picture Aubrey waving, but her hand is on fire.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Hi!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Barclay says

speaker: Barclay
lines: Hi Mama, hi…

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Aubrey!

speaker: Barclay
lines: It’s, uh— hi, Aubrey?

speaker: Griffin
lines: He looks, like, just as uncomfortable as he did when you first ran into him in the woods when you weren’t supposed to, Ned. And Mama says

speaker: Mama
lines: So, uh, what brings you out into the woods in the middle of the night with Ned fuckin’ Chicane, Barclay?

speaker: Ned
lines: How did you know my middle name?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Barclay says

speaker: Barclay
lines: He’s, uh, he’s seen a lot tonight, Mama. I think we’ve gotta tell—wait, wait, what are you doing in the woods with her?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Aubrey!

speaker: Barclay
lines: Yeah!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Mama at this point looks like she’s about to, like, lose it. She is— things are going very, very— things are getting out of hand. And that’s, in fact she says, like

speaker: Mama
lines: All right, look. Things are getting a little bit outta hand tonight. We’ve kept this gate a secret for—

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Ned, you can see the gate.

speaker: Ned
lines: What gate—? Oh.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, she says that and it just appears right in front of you, and you can see it sort of pressed into the fender of your Continental. It is—

speaker: Ned
lines: Oh, shit. This is going to end up on a Farmers Insurance commercial, isn’t it?

speaker: Griffin
lines: She notices you, like, now you can see the gate ‘cause she said that, and she didn’t even think about it, but now she knows that she’s sort of let this slip again, and she says

speaker: Mama
lines: Shit! All right, okay—that’s it, though! Ned, there’s powerful cosmic forces at work here, stuff that’s gotta stay out of the public eye! I don’t know if we can trust you, Ned fuckin’ Chicane, but I need you to trust me when I say that there’d be dire consequences if anyone else in Kepler found out about this gate in the woods. Do you understand me?

speaker: Griffin
lines: [audibly grinning] And it’s at that point that the gate is, just for a moment, filled with light, and out steps Duck Newton. Duck, you are back in the woods, and here’s four people who are all kind of looking at you with shock. Especially Mama and Barclay. They look kind of dumbfounded and kind of horrified as you step foot back into Kepler.

speaker: Duck
lines: Uh, I’m District Ranger Duck Newton, it’s a nickname, and, uh, ma’am, I’m going to need you to extinguish that flame, please.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Oh, yeah! [makes ‘pschoo’ noise]

speaker: Duck
lines: Thank you very much.

speaker: Travis
lines: And I also want to say, uh, Aubrey makes that sound when she does it. [makes ‘pschoo’ noise again]

speaker: Griffin
lines: Mama looks at you, Duck, for a few seconds, just— her mouth agape in sort of disbelief at how quickly this situation has spiraled, and she says

speaker: Mama
lines: Duck. Newton. What the hell have you done?

speaker: Duck
lines: I have absolutely no idea.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [laughing] She says

speaker: Mama
lines: How did you see the— why did you go through the gate, Duck?

speaker: Duck
lines: Well, I was bein’ chased by a spooky bear.

speaker: Clint
lines: [Yogi Bear accent] “Hey there, it’s Spooky Bear!”

speaker: Griffin
lines: She says

speaker: Mama
lines: A big, spooky bear, huh?

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Barclay says

speaker: Barclay
lines: He’s, um, he’s not lyin’, Mama. Ned and I, we had a run in with… well, with part of the Abomination, I- I think. It’s complicated. We— we really should get hunting tonight.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Mama kind of sighs, and rubs her head, and she says

speaker: Mama
lines: But how did he find out about—[sigh] All right. Okay. Here’s the plan, everybody. Me and Barclay, we gotta pop through that gate for just a couple minutes, find out how much diplomatic damage Duck just wreaked over there, try to smooth it over. You three are gonna stay put right here. Don’t move a muscle, and when we get out, I can explain how much trouble the five of us are in back at the lodge.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Okay!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And with that, Mama reaches into the interior pocket of her duster, and she pulls out this small compact mirror. She opens it up and she catches some of the moonlight above in it, and it reflects back onto the gate, which hums quietly. And Duck, you see that wind whipping off of the gate again, just before the span of the archway is filled with this white light. And Barclay steps through and disappears. And Mama turns to you, Aubrey, and she says

speaker: Mama
lines: I need you to have my back on this, all right? I need you to make sure these two chuckleheads don’t run off. We gotta keep this secret, remember?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yeah! If they try to run off, I’ll… burn ‘em to the ground?

speaker: Mama
lines: Well, don’t, no, don’t— come on.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Okay, no. I— even as I was saying it, I knew that it was too much.

speaker: Mama
lines: Yeah, you realised it was bad.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And Mama turns and steps through the gate, and the wind stops, and the light inside the archway disappears. And now it’s just the three of you standing in the middle of this clearing, in the middle of the woods, in the middle of the night.

speaker: Ned
lines: Welcome to my fucking awesome dream, Duck.

speaker: Duck
lines: Well, I hate to break it to ya, I don’t think you are technically dreaming, Ned.

speaker: Ned
lines: Huh? What?

speaker: Duck
lines: Well if it’s one of those— unless it’s one of those shared dreams. I saw on Dr. Oz some people… anyways.

speaker: Ned
lines: Oh I saw that one!

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah, shared dreams.

speaker: Ned
lines: So you’re trying to tell me this is real?

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah it’s real as uh, I mean as far as I know it’s as real as anything.

speaker: Ned
lines: Holy shit!

speaker: Aubrey
lines: I mean “real” is really a relative term if you think about it.

speaker: Duck
lines: Aw hey! [crosstalk] I recognize you!

speaker: Aubrey
lines: [crosstalk] Yeah hi, Ranger Rick.

speaker: Duck
lines: Well, it’s Duck…

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Okay.

speaker: Ned
lines: Hello!

speaker: Duck
lines: I remember you you’re that um… ah, where was it? Over near Laurel Fork, right? I busted you for…

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Sure.

speaker: Duck
lines: What was it? Torch- Torch Girl? Was that it? I’m tryin’ to remember.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: No it’s… The Lady Flame.

speaker: Duck
lines: Lady Flame! That’s right.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: I had the rabbit?

speaker: Duck
lines: You uh… your hands were on fire, huh?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yeah! Yeah, apparently I can do magic. Right?

speaker: Duck
lines: Huh, sounds like a big night.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Yeah! I mean— yeah, right?

speaker: Duck
lines: Can I ask, Ned? And I do expect some sort of recognition for waiting this long to sort of inquire, why is it that you are dressed like a, the Chewbacca?

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Oh yeah! That was the— I was trying to— I couldn’t put my finger on it.

speaker: Ned
lines: Well I have some friends we get together and go see Star Wars but no— I was goofing around, I was trying to do a whole… Bigfoot thing. And it’s hotter than shit. I’m going to take it off.

speaker: Duck
lines: Dressed like a… like a yahoo?

speaker: Ned
lines: Uh, yeah. I was dressed like a yahoo for a big old yahoo. You know—

speaker: Duck
lines: Haha, I get it. I get it.

speaker: Ned
lines: Well I mean up until tonight I thought all this was horseshit.

speaker: Duck
lines: Torch Girl you probably don’t know this but uh…

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Lady Flame.

speaker: Duck
lines: Sorry! Darnit.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: You can just call me Aubrey if that’s easier?

speaker: Duck
lines: You know what? I get confused between “Aubrey” and “Audrey” so much I’m gonna stick with Lady Flame, I think.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Okay.

speaker: Duck
lines: But ‘round these parts we have a— the old timers call it “Yahoo Holler” ‘cause of the— they call ‘em— most people call ‘em “Bigfoots”  but they call ‘em “Yahoos” ‘cause that’s…

speaker: Aubrey
lines: Aah, the Sas-quatch!

speaker: Duck
lines: Sasquatch, yeah.

speaker: Aubrey
lines: The woodland ape!

speaker: Duck
lines: Yeah, Sasquatch I guess.

speaker: Griffin
lines: While this conversation’s happening, I like the scene of Ned sort of in the background trying to unzip the Wookiee costume and is like—

speaker: Ned
lines: Little help please! Little help!

speaker: Griffin
lines: —In the middle of stepping out of it, and suddenly there is a deep guttural sigh from the edge of the clearing, and the three of you turn to face it. And with the moon’s light above and the light from the oil lantern, which Mama set down right in front of the gate before she stepped through, there is no obscurity about the beast the three of you are facing just, like, 10 yards away. It is a horrible sight eight feet tall and nearly as wide. And a roar comes from this beast, projected from the agonized face of a massive black bear. And Ned? You see that same sort of lifeless expression you that recognized in the bobcat earlier. [music fades in] Horrifyingly, you also see it on several other faces that are jutting out of this beast. A wolf’s face sits motionless on the neck of this creature. From its shoulder a stag’s head is, like, half submerged in its form and its antler is protruding sharply from the mass. A half dozen forest creatures are embedded in this thing. And not just their faces, this whole being is covered in their pelts, forming a thick patchwork hide all around it. The three of you survey this nightmare in an instant as it makes its presence known, and then it charges.

speaker: This is our first sort of group combat thing and I want to make it clear that in this game there is no initiative. I don’t really roll, I can set up soft moves to set up, like, elements of danger for you all to respond to, but I don’t really get a turn to attack. My actions are all in response to you. And because there is no initiative the three of you kind of have to play fair and play collaboratively. If one of you takes a turn I kind of won’t let you go again until the other two also take an action— but in terms of, y’know, who goes first and who does what and in what order? It’s up to you guys to decide and you kind of need to keep in mind what is going to be the most narratively interesting and set each other up and help each other out. It’s pretty loosey-goosey. So with that in mind, what do you do?
Travis
lines: How far away is the bear?

speaker: Griffin
lines: It was 10 yards away. Getting closer.

speaker: Clint
lines: Ned reaches into the trunk of the Lincoln and pulls out the big heavy walking stick. It’s got a huge— it almost looks like a drum major’s baton from marching band.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s got a thing at the end?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, great big heavy metal brass knob at the end of it and he says

speaker: Ned
lines: Duck!

speaker: Clint
lines: Which he realizes now, if he does, everybody’s gonna duck.

speaker: Justin
lines: And they do.

speaker: Clint
lines: Says it anyway and so he throws it and it goes sailing over Duck’s head ‘cause he ducked.

speaker: Justin
lines: No, I caught it.

speaker: Clint
lines: It lands— no.

speaker: Justin
lines: I caught it. I’m used to it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, I won’t make you roll for that. I think you toss Duck the weapon. Do you do anything else? Sort of with your action here?

speaker: Clint
lines: I start rummaging through the trunk ‘cause I got another idea. But as long as I’m at the trunk I think that enabling— enabling Duck will accomplish what I wanna do. You want me to roll?

speaker: Griffin
lines: No! No, I think we can figure out— you have gear that is like on your starting character sheet, and if you’re looking for something else that’s cool and we will get to that here in a little bit.

speaker: Clint
lines: He starts rummaging through the trunk.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright, Duck, you catch the walking stick. We’ll go to you next before we get to Aubrey. What do you do?

speaker: Justin
lines: Can you lay out the scene for me? Like, positioning-wise, what's going on?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, I mean, the three of you are pretty close. You got your back basically to this arch, with the oil lantern laying on the ground and the Continental kind of busted up a little bit in the side of the arch. Which, by the way, I should mention the archway was not even remotely damaged, or seemingly affected at all, by your car crashing into it. The beast is now, like, five yards away from you guys and is sort of charging right— right at you, towards you and the archway, and you're holding the walking stick.

speaker: Justin
lines: Alright. Duck scoops up the lantern and then runs around to the other side of the gate and starts yelling at the monsters.

speaker: Duck
lines: Woo-hoo! Come here! Come on, dum-dums! Right over here!

speaker: Justin
lines: Making a lot of noise and trying to get them to charge straight at him.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I love it! I think this would be an Act Under Pressure roll. Like you're trying to do someth— fuck it, you’re under pressure and you’re acting. Like this is explicitly that. So…

speaker: Justin
lines: Let's see… eight!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Eight! A mixed success, okay, alright. I think that the trade off here is— with a mixed success you do what you're trying to do, and I know what you're trying to do, but there is a slight cost to it. So you are taunting this creature to run right at you and it does and it slams right into the gate which it does not see. And as it does so, it sort of— you hear it sort of whine in pain as it does. But that— the antlers in its shoulder kind of goes through the gate and you were just a little bit closer, you did not expect it to have that much reach, and those antlers just get you for— I mean they jab right into you, for three harm.

speaker: Justin
lines: Eugh, one harm…

speaker: Clint
lines: What happened to Invincible? Oh right, two…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah he has two armor which like negates some of it. And the beast, I think, takes— takes two harm. Well, it would take two harm but for whatever reason this plan went, y'know, perfectly how you kind of envisioned it. It was a very good Punk’d you did to this big beast. But it didn't do quite as much damage as you were expecting, almost as if like this thing is also pretty tough right now. And it kind of wedges itself out backward from the gate, and we will jump to Aubrey.

speaker: Travis
lines: Aubrey grabs the lantern from Duck and throws it at the creature's face.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: It is still lit, correct?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, it’s lit as hell.

speaker: Travis
lines: Excellent.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I don’t think you’d need to roll for this. This is not, you know— If you’re throwing a lantern at it, maybe you just Act Under Pressure, but I think you just do it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m trying to follow the rules here and I feel like this is not a traditional… it’s not Kick Some Ass, right? You were throwing a lantern at the thing. If anything it’s Act Under Pressure.

speaker: Travis
lines: And it’s very close, right, at this point.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s real close and it’s huge. I think you can pretty confidently throw this oil lantern at the thing. All right, you chuck the oil lantern at its face. You don’t have to roll, this is not a fight thing. This is just you doing something very clever. The oil lantern shatters as it hits the beast’s face, and the oil sort of covers it like at least the top portion of it, and the fire quickly spreads and that pelt, that patchwork pelt which you can kind of see, like, that black slime that you saw earlier, Ned, is kind of like holding it together a little bit like glue. This pelt is now just ablaze. It’s ablaze because it’s now covered in burning oil but it also just seems like it is just very flammable, almost, ‘cuz this thing just goes up and it is on fire and it takes three harm as this fire is spreading all around it, and it looks pretty enraged. And I think with that, Aubrey, it is going to look at you and kind of roar, because it knows that you just set it on fire.

speaker: Travis
lines: Shit!

speaker: Griffin
lines: And now it is charging at you. This is a soft move. It’s not me saying I’m gonna do some damage, but now there is some danger going on.

speaker: Clint
lines: Ned has found what he’s looking for in the trunk.

speaker: Griffin
lines: All right.

speaker: Clint
lines: It’s that great big jug, and when she yelled “shit” just a minute ago, that reminded him. It’s that great big jug that he filled from the septic tank, with all that nasty shit.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: And animal droppings and everything else.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I did not know that that fluid was as gross as you’re describing.

speaker: Clint
lines: Aw, it’s really gross.

speaker: Travis
lines: So wait, in the septic tank, animals have been using your toilet too?

speaker: Clint
lines: Well everything says, it’s not a very effective septic tank…

speaker: Griffin
lines: It’s a service the Cryptonomica provides, where animals can come and use their toilet.

speaker: Clint
lines: And also I’ve been dumping all this shit in there— I’m not a very good homeowner.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’re a real fuckin’ cousin Randy from Christmas Vacation.

speaker: Justin
lines: Eddie, Eddie.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Cousin Eddie, thank you.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, well, he’s got a lip fungus we ain’t identified yet. Ned grabs this jug, runs over and throws it in the air. It’s arcing towards the path in front of the beast, and it hits the ground and shatters and this horrible stench, this horrible stink and all of this stuff splatters all over the place, and Ned says

speaker: Ned
lines: Huh. No methane. Well, it was a great idea.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I think this thing— you were trying to create some sort of literal stink bomb, which I appreciate.

speaker: Clint
lines: I think, yeah, a little napalm.

speaker: Griffin
lines: But I think that something kinda curious happens. This thing was about to come down on Aubrey, but as this jug of, you said there was like animal droppings and stuff in it?

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: As this thing smells, like, picks up the scent of a bunch of different animals, even though it is on fire and even though it is about to attack this thing that is endangering it, it’s almost like this more primary instinct kicks in. And you see it whip its head around and look toward the direction of the jug, and now it’s sniffing around almost like a hunter who has just like picked up the trail of its prey. And you have definitely definitely, accidentally it sounds like, sort of distracted it away from its attack. What do you all do?

speaker: Travis
lines: Aubrey’s gonna do some magic.

speaker: Griffin
lines: All right. This is your magic attack or do you just do magic?

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, one of the things that I can do, of one of the effects I can do is Enchant a Weapon, and it gets plus one harm and plus magic, so I am going to… this is my logic. The fire hurt the thing. Duck is standing there holding a weapon. I’m going to enchant it, set it on fire.

speaker: Griffin
lines: All right.

speaker: Travis
lines: That’s a seven plus two, so nine.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yep, that’s a mixed success.

speaker: Justin
lines: She sets it on fire, but then it burns Duck’s hands and he drops it.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, the walking stick is on fire. It is also made out of wood. So it is on fire and it is enchanted, and what does that do, it gives it plus one magic attack?

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s plus one harm and says plus magic, which I don’t…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. So there’s a system of tags that comes on every single item in this game, and it just sort of informs the fiction. So if there’s a monster that could only be hurt by magic, so for instance, like a ghost or something who couldn’t be hit by a physical weapon, but a magical weapon could actually harm it. Then, if something has the magic tag, then you’re good to go. So you have set this walking stick on fire, but it is also made out of wood, so if it stays like this for a long time it’s going to be gone. But Duck, you can safely hold it.

speaker: Justin
lines: Well, I guess I’m gonna kick some ass.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Hell yeah.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Roll 2d6.

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m gonna slam the, I’m aiming to just slam the, uh, thing right down on its noggin.

speaker: Justin
lines: Oh shit! That is a 13!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Jesus Christ, these rolls.

speaker: Justin
lines: I rolled 2d6— two sixes.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, sure did. Plus since the gear had a one harm hand.

speaker: Griffin
lines: It actually has two harm ‘cuz it was enchanted.

speaker: Clint
lines: Cool.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And it was enchanted with fire, so on a 10-plus, choose one effect. You gain the advantage, take plus one forward, or give plus one forward to another hunter. You inflict terrible harm, plus one harm. You suffer less harm, minus one harm. Or you force them where you want them. So you get to pick one effect in addition to the two sort of fiery magical damage that you are also dealing.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay, I guess I’m just gonna inflict an additional harm then.

speaker: Griffin
lines: All right.

speaker: Justin
lines: I was trying to preserve it somehow, ‘cuz I feel like that would be Duck’s instinct. Be he also, he’s not a doofus, like this

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, preserve us first.

speaker: Justin
lines: An imminent danger to these other people.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So on a kick-ass, on a Kick Some Ass the way this works is both of you deal damage. So describe what you do again.

speaker: Justin
lines: I’m just… the lantern, the oil is on his head as well right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: Like that’s where I would be aiming for. One of the heads? Are there multiple heads?

speaker: Griffin
lines: The way this thing is, it’s got this main bear head. It kind of almost has the body of bear, sort of, but a huge one, with all these other animals kind of absorbed into it.

speaker: Clint
lines: Like their faces?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Like all their bodies and stuff.

speaker: Justin
lines: Alright yeah, so I’m aiming for the bear head.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Alright you clobber this, you bring the flaming brass tip of this walking stick down on top of the bear’s skull. And you hear this, sort of, if you’ll pardon the pun, grisly crack as you do so, and this thing takes three harm as you bash into it, thanks to all of your different bonuses. And it sort of whips around as you do that, and it catches you with the horns again, and this time it kind of like picks you up and knocks you back a few feet. You keep your footing, but it sort of hits you real hard with these antlers for another three harm.

speaker: Justin
lines: Damn.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So, by my calculations…

speaker: Justin
lines: Fuck, that hurts.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You’ve taken two harm at this point.

speaker: Justin
lines: Correct.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And once you get to four, things start getting very very serious, but you’re not quite there yet. All right, here’s what happens next.

speaker: The three of you at this point have sort of independently experienced something profound in this moment. You have been confronted with death itself. With a monstrosity that defies every known natural order of this world. And yet your instinct was not that of absolute fear, as it would be for any other human who encountered this beast, you stood your ground and you fought. And maybe you knew why you’re fighting and maybe you didn’t, but regardless you all have this remarkable feeling, a kind of inexplicable assurance, that you can do this.

And then Ned, you feel something fall and tap on your shoulder, and Aubrey you feel it too, in your hair, kind of dripping cold down the back of your neck. And Duck, you see the trees start to sway, in a manner you’ve seen countless times during your patrols of these woods. And there’s a peal of thunder overhead, and then the skies open up.

And this sudden storm is bashing against the roof of the Continental, and it douses the flames that were spreading across the beast, which looks up at the sky and then, with otherworldly malice, back down at the three of you.
[Theme music (The Adventure Zone
lines: Amnesty Theme by Griffin McElroy) plays]

speaker: [a]Is he saying "sylph" deliberately as if it's linguistically connected to Sylvane/Silvane or is it just meant to be a straight up abbreviation (silv', sylv')? I'm leaving it as sylph, lowercase, because i think it's cooler, but that could change
[b]Mama more clearly calls the residents of Sylvane "Sylvs" in {20
lines: 10} so I assume it's the same

speaker: [c]I can’t remember which ep but in a way earlier one we decided “Sylphs” would be the name for those in Sylvane. But if they pronounce it “Sylv” then write it like that.
Working with an audio medium with no official guide is tough
